  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 28

Words 2701-2800

  1. tiny
    The baby held a tiny flower in her hand.

  2. tip
    He gave me a useful tip for solving the problem.

  3. tired
    She felt tired after working all day.

  4. title
    The title of the book caught my attention.

  5. to
    She went to the park to relax.

  6. today
    Today is a perfect day for a picnic.

  7. toe
    He accidentally hit his toe on the table.

  8. together
    They worked together to finish the project.

  9. toilet
    The toilet in the restaurant was very clean.

  10. tomato
    She added a fresh tomato to the salad.

  11. tomorrow
    We will visit the museum tomorrow.

  12. tone
    His tone of voice was calm and friendly.

  13. tongue
    She bit her tongue while eating.

  14. tonight
    We are going to watch a movie tonight.

  15. too
    The coffee was too hot to drink.

  16. tool
    He used a tool to fix the broken chair.

  17. tooth
    She brushed her tooth carefully before bed.

  18. top
    The top of the mountain was covered in snow.

  19. topic
    The topic of the discussion was very interesting.

  20. total
    The total cost of the meal was $20.

  21. totally
    I totally agree with your opinion.

  22. touch
    The baby reached out to touch the soft blanket.

  23. tough
    The exam was tough, but she did her best.

  24. tour
    We went on a tour of the old castle.

  25. tourism
    Tourism is an important industry in this country.

  26. tourist
    The tourist asked for directions to the museum.

  27. towards
    He walked towards the bus stop.

  28. towel
    She dried her hands with a clean towel.

  29. tower
    The tower offers a great view of the city.

  30. town
    The town is famous for its historic buildings.

  31. toy
    The child played with a colorful toy.

  32. track
    The train moved quickly along the track.

  33. trade
    Trade between the two countries has increased.

  34. tradition
    It is a tradition to celebrate the festival every year.

  35. traditional
    They wore traditional clothes for the ceremony.

  36. traffic
    The traffic was heavy during rush hour.

  37. train
    She took the train to visit her family.

  38. trainer
    The trainer helped the team improve their skills.

  39. training
    The company provides training for new employees.

  40. transfer
    He needs to transfer money to his friend’s account.

  41. transform
    The old building was transformed into a modern hotel.

  42. transition
    The transition from school to work can be challenging.

  43. translate
    Can you translate this sentence into English?

  44. translation
    The translation of the book was very accurate.

  45. transport
    Public transport is convenient in the city.

  46. travel
    They love to travel to new places every year.

  47. traveller
    The traveller shared stories about his adventures.

  48. treat
    She decided to treat herself to a nice dinner.

  49. treatment
    The treatment for the illness was successful.

  50. tree
    The tree in the garden is very tall.

  51. trend
    There is a new trend in fashion this season.

  52. trial
    The trial lasted for several weeks.

  53. trick
    He showed me a clever card trick.

  54. trip
    They planned a trip to the mountains.

  55. tropical
    The island has a tropical climate.

  56. trouble
    He was in trouble for breaking the rules.

  57. trousers
    He bought a new pair of trousers for work.

  58. truck
    The truck delivered goods to the store.

  59. true
    It is true that exercise is good for health.

  60. truly
    She is truly grateful for their support.

  61. trust
    I trust him to make the right decision.

  62. truth
    The truth about the incident was revealed.

  63. try
    You should try this new recipe for dinner.

  64. T-shirt
    He wore a blue T-shirt and jeans.

  65. tube
    The toothpaste comes in a small tube.

  66. Tuesday
    We have a meeting on Tuesday morning.

  67. tune
    The musician played a beautiful tune on the piano.

  68. tunnel
    The train passed through a long tunnel.

  69. turn
    It is your turn to roll the dice.

  70. TV
    They watched the news on TV last night.

  71. twelve
    There are twelve months in a year.

  72. twenty
    She bought twenty apples from the market.

  73. twice
    He called me twice but I missed both calls.

  74. twin
    The twin brothers look exactly alike.

  75. two
    She has two cats and a dog.

  76. type
    What type of music do you like?

  77. typical
    It was a typical day at work for him.

  78. typically
    She typically arrives at the office by 9 a.m.

  79. tyre
    The car’s front tyre was flat.

  80. ugly
    The old building looked ugly and abandoned.

  81. ultimately
    Ultimately, the decision is up to you.

  82. umbrella
    She carried an umbrella because it was raining.

  83. unable
    He was unable to attend the meeting.

  84. uncle
    My uncle lives in a small village.

  85. uncomfortable
    The chair was so uncomfortable that I couldn’t sit for long.

  86. unconscious
    He was unconscious after the accident.

  87. under
    The keys are under the table.

  88. underground
    The underground train is very fast.

  89. understand
    I understand the instructions clearly.

  90. understanding
    She has a good understanding of the subject.

  91. underwear
    He packed clean underwear for the trip.

  92. unemployed
    Many people became unemployed during the crisis.

  93. unemployment
    The government is working to reduce unemployment.

  94. unexpected
    The unexpected rain ruined our picnic.

  95. unfair
    It is unfair to blame her for the mistake.

  96. unfortunately
    Unfortunately, we missed the last bus.

  97. unhappy
    She was unhappy with the results of the test.

  98. uniform
    The students wear a uniform to school every day.

  99. union
    The workers formed a union to protect their rights.

  100. unique
    Each painting in the gallery is unique.
